document_title: Anal abscess: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Anal abscesses often occur in subjects in the following risk groups:
Men (men are twice as likely to develop anal abscess as women).; People with the following diseases: Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, enteritis, diabetes, constipation, diarrhea.; The immune system is affected by HIV/AIDS infection; Anal sex.; Use of Prednisone or other Steroids; People who have been or are undergoing chemotherapy.; Use of immunosuppressive drugs; Smoking habit.; Diabetes.
